1.content: Are you a Male or a Female?
1.title: Let's get started

11.content:
Are you a Human or a Pokemon?

The Caffinated Critic is also here but beware, he shows you all of the spoilers!
11.title: Male

111.content:
You woke up on a beach. No one there to look around for. You get up, and you realize that before you got here, you were on a boat with your family. A tidal wave hit the boat and it started to sink. You were separated from your parents, and got lost. Lost I tell you! There was nothing on the beach but you. There is a forest right beside you, and you think you should make a shelter or search for some berries.

What would you do?
111.title: Human

choices: Enter the cave anyway, the sound could have been anything.
Make your way back to the sticks.. it seems that's your best option
1111.content:
You quickly scan the beach for anything you could use to make a shelter, and coming up with little to nothing, your eyes fall on the forest just a bit aways from you.
You decide to find supplies for a shelter from in there, it's obviously got more than out here.
Only a few feet into the forest, you hear deep thuds, and the ground rumbling slightly, as if something heavy was repeatedly smashing into the ground.. but you shrug it off, it could be a number of things, also not worth worrying about when you're stranded on an island. You continue to search for supplies, but soon realize you have no idea what's needed for a shelter, let alone how to make one. After a moment of worry, you notice an arm length stick leaning up against a tree.. it took a moment to click, but you figured you could lean many sticks against a wall of some sort to create a sort of roof. You don't know how efficient this will be, but it's the best option you've got.. so for the moment, you begin collecting sticks, starting with the one on the tree.
All this time, you've been trying to ignore the banging, but it seems like now it's louder than before.. and you almost think you hear it coming from different directions, like there was more than one of what's causing it. You shudder and dismiss the thought, it must be nerves.. for that to be true ... you don't know, you just get a bad feeling about the idea.

Now a bit on edge, you continue walking, until you see in the distance to your right, a cave connecting into a mountain. You know some animal MIGHT be living in it, but the threat isn't really that big, and besides, it's a much better shelter than what you'd be making! You're tired, and probably delusional (making you hear the banging) you need to rest, and this seems like a gift from god at this point!

In a rush, you drop your handful of sticks and set off at a run for the cave, stopping right before the entrance.
You feel almost happy for a moment.. until you hear a deep rumbling from inside the cave. It sounded kind of like the sound your stomache makes when you're really hungry, except much louder, and deeper. You stand there, dead in your tracks, wondering what it could have been..
Nothing as big as it sounded.. the sound was probably magnified through echoes.. it might have just been rocks falling or something..

And plus, you're tired, you NEED a place to stay..

you...?
1111.title: Finding Supplies

choices: Try anyway:  you're smarter than most it's meals.. you'll find a way!
Give up and accept your fate.. it might be quick afterall...
11111.content:
With new-found courage (or stupidity) you walk tentatively into the cave.
You make it 15 steps in before calming and saying to yourself, "See nothing in he--.." You pause in mid-sentence as all the light in the cave goes out.
You quickly whirl around to find out what happened, but all you can tell is that something's blocking the cave entrance, it has the vague shape of a boulder.

'Great' you think, walking towards it, agitated, 'How am I supposed to move a boulder?"
You get closer but as your eyes adjust to the darkness, you see a boulder would have been a blessing.
You see a giant cubone looking down at you with a smirk, it's leaning against it's bone-club which is being used to block the entrance.
It's expression looks like a taunting happiness as it licks it's lips, which looks like it's licking the skull on it's head.. it'd look funny if you didn't fear you were the main course. You begin backing up, your mind racing for any way out, until you walk straight into a wall behind you... this was a one sided cave.. and cubone was blocking the only exit. Then you realize, it must do this all the time. Never leaving it's home, all it has to do for food is wait for it's prey to walk willing up to it.

With this realization, it dawns on you that it knows how to keep it's lunch inside.. your chance of escape was little to none
you...?
11111.title: Who turned out the lights? o.o

choices: Grab a fist sized rock.. this may work for something..
111111.content:
Determined, you at the cubone's right side, opposite of where his bone is, but just as you get within arms reach, you skirt to the side, heading straight in-between his legs. Confident that his prey hardly ever runs at him, you're sure this will throw him off for a secon, giving you the needed time to get around, and hopefully get behind the bone. You get through enough and see you were right, there was a small sliver of space between his bone and the exit; you can make it!
You ran straight passed his legs easily, it was almost like the cubone wasn't trying to stop you!
Just as you were nearing the exit, in a flash, his tail fell in your path. Unable to stop fast enough, you slammed face-first into it, sending you falling onto your back.
Looking up, you see cubone towering over you, only seeing part of his face, the rest covered up by his tummy. He was laughing a cruel laugh: he truly got delight from this.. you didn't have a chance from the start.
He began reaching down, you had no way to escape now
you...?
111111.title: I'm no TV dinner!

1111111.content:
In a last, desperate attempt, you begin sputtering out words, hoping he understood you, "W-wait! You seem awesome! really nice, and smart! Wanna be friends? It'd be-" Your words were cut off as his fist wrapped around you and lifting, knocking your breathe out and leaving nothing but your head exposed. That didn't work.. you'd think the 'lonely' pokemon would want a friend. "Er-- I can help you find more food!" nothing, he's still bringing you closer to his gigantic mouth, "I mean-" You say hurriedly, "I'm nothing: A mere snack! I could.. find you entire colonies! I know where a bunch of pokemon live!" You lie.. but it's no use, it's obvious the pokemon doesn't understand you, you can do nothing but squirm in his hand as his brings you up to his mouth.
"Nice try." It says in an almost whisper (like a shout, when you're a foot away from it's maw) With the two words came a wave of hot moiste breathe that smelled of terrible rotten.. you don't want to think about what, and you also don't want it to be the last thing you smell.
Then, as it tosses you into it's mouth, you realize it completely understood everything you said, it didn't care. 'A mere snack', you'd said.. and that's exactly what you were, what you said to it meant nothing, there was nothing you could have said to change your fate.
You flew into his mouth as his jaws snapped shut.
The back of his throat was the last thing you saw.
1111111.title: Diplomacy?   Make friends with him

choices: Go and pick it up, the rest have got to be close
Avoid it altogether, still on edge from the cave: this seems suspicious
11112.content:
Flustered and paranoid, you walk back to where you'd dropped the sticks. As you walk, you begin to calm down; whatever was in there is gone now, just relax and build your shelter... But something isn't right, you know this is where you broke into a run, where your sticks should be laying still.. but they're not anywhere around..
You had at least an armful of perfect-length limbs, and now they're all gone! Looking around, you see one cast aside feet in front of you, right in front of a very large bush...
11112.title: Who stole my sticks!

choices: Remain where you are, too stunned to think, or even move
111121.content:
You go to pick up the stick, but as you reach toward it, you hear a rustling in the bush. You look up just in time to see a large figure burst from it's depths; a typhlosion flying straight at you. You jump to the side, and the pokemon misses you only by inches, sending you stumbling backwards into a fall.
It lands and immediately turns to face you, now standing on all fours above you.. you notice something's not right about this typhlosion. Aside from the hungry expression, it's at least twice the size of a regular typhlosion! and you don't like the way it's eyeing you...
111121.title: I'll be taking my sticks back.

choices: Use your surroundings;  anything weapon-like nearby?
1111212.content: Eyes wide in shock and disbelief, you kick backwards trying to get away, as your hands grasp the ground for anything of use. Your fist wraps around a large stone almost immediately, and quickly you throw it as hard as you can at the typhlosion just as it's rearing back for an attack- mouth wide open. Luck: the stone sails through the air and connects with the pokemon's eye, causing it to stagger back.. giving you a few seconds leeway. You flip yourself over and begin hurrying away, on all fours for a moment before you push yourself back to your feet. You're hardly moving before you hear the typhlosion's heavy footfalls behind you.. obviously moving faster than you could possibly hope to run.
1111212.title: run first, think later

choices: Run into the thicker forest underbrush,  hide out there
11112121.content:
Impulse.
That's the only thing to describe what you did next.
As you hear the typhlosion closing in, an idea strikes you, and you stop moving completely. It sounds like it's just behind you now, and at that you turn on your heels and dive to the floor, watching as the typhlosion sails over you; it's claws missing you only by a few inches, you feel a drop of drool hit your back as it flies past.. that could have ended terribly.
But there's no time to think about that, now you've got to..
11112121.title: Come at me bro

choices: Continue choking:  it's him or you
try to reason with him? o.o
111121212.content:
Without missing a beat, you grasp a small branch from the floor and run at the typhlosion. As soon as it lands you're on top of it.. well.. kind of.
It lands facing away from you, you're right behind it, normally, you might be able to jump right onto it's back.. but due to it's abnormal size, your head hardly reaches the bottom of his.. bottom end. With nothing to lose, you continue at it and jump, hands grasping the bottom-most fur on his back, one foot dangling off, the other barely finding traction on the side of his leg. This move sent the typhlosion into a furious rage. It reared back onto it's hind legs then slammed back down onto all fours in an attempt to through you off.. which almost worked, but at the last second, you threw your weight forward: using the velocity from his fall to throw you onto his back. "Check," you mumble, stumbling forward to where your hands could easily grab his neck. At least now you were out of reach of his mouth.. but he was kicking and flailing furiously, making every attempt to throw you off. He even rammed his back into a tree in attempt to crush you.. only barely missing as you slid to his side for long enough to dodge it. Now you didn't know what to do.. you were away from his mouth, but it was only a matter of time before he got you off one way or another.. and your arms were already getting tired and the stick in your hand wasn't helping.. if you fell now, no doubt you'd be sliding down that throat in no time... that throat!
Then it hit you: you let go of his neck with one hand long enough to pull the stick around around his neck, and grabbed it with your other hand. You pulled on it with all your strength, both hands gripping it and hoping it didn't break. The typhlosion stopped it's mad attempts to throw you off and was now coughing and clawing at the stick. You didn't plan to kill it, but what other option did you have!?
111121212.title: Act: running won't help anymore

choices: let go of the stick and toss away, to show you meant fully what you said
Take the stick away from his throat, but keep hold of it.. no use taking chances
1111212122.content:
Your expression harsh, you decide to give the typhlosion one last chance, "Can you understand me!?" you demand, then despite your better judgement, loosen your grip on the branch to show the typhlosion what'd be in it for him if he complied.
It half coughed, half spit fire in response, there was obvious anger in the answer, as if challenging you to let go of the stick 'just see what happens,' it expression seemed to say.
In spite of this, your face softened.. but you couldn't let up just because it understood you. You tightened your grip, pulling back with full force again. "Good," you start, "then let's how much we understand eachother, eh?" upon finishing that, you tugged back on the stick for a moment warningly, then loosened enough for it to get in a short sputtering breathe, "Now.. let's make a deal--" it thrashed angrily against the stick upon you saying this, but relaxed after a moment, your cue to continue, "I'll let go of this stick, and you'll let me continue a life outside your stomache, capiche?" you say, giving another hard tug on the stick, but this time not letting up, you continue with the pressure and move in closer to it's ear, "Or.. I could kill you now, if you refuse my offer, so what'll it be?" you did your best to keep a hard tone, but in truth, you hated to do this- even to a man-eating pokemon, and you were afraid that showed in your voice, despite your best effort.
You then loosened up on the stick again, waiting for it to react.. you imagine if it hated the idea, it'd go into another fit of rage.. but instead, it just blew out a puff of smoke, it's eyes closed indignantly.
this seems to be a mutual agreement, you should
1111212122.title: Promise not to eat me, then we'll talk.

11112121222.content:
"Good.." you say tentatively, slowly pulling the stick away from his throat and waiting to see how he acts...
When the typhlosion did nothing but lower it's body close to the ground, crouching on it's front legs to let you off, you let out a sigh of relief and climbed down. You walked a few steps away, then turned back to the typhlosion to say goodbye and thanks.. but as you turned, you see that it's eyes are locked on the stick still in your hand, filled with rage. A low growl came from deep within it's throat as his slowly edged forward.. and then you realized that you still holding the stick must seem like an act of betrayal to him.. he followed through with his part of the deal, but you appear to have only partly done so...
you stared up at the typhlosion, now practically on top of you helplessly. Another low rumble came from him again.. but this time it was his stomach. His eyes glanced at his tummy for a moment, and smirked at the sound, if he could laugh, you're sure he would be right now. You dropped the stick, in a desperate hope that he'd spare you, but only made him take another step forward, placing his paws on your shoulders to stop any resistance completely now.

You closed your eyes and felt a few drops of drool fall onto you, and just a moment later, felt something large and moist wrap around your face, pulling you in slowly.

You never opened your eyes again.
11112121222.title: Take the stick away from his throat, but keep h...

111122.content:
It seems like something is toying with you. Or is it just your imagination? You shake it off and move along looking for more sticks. You find some (more) good sticks and began laying them out. You're feel very lucky that you learned about this when you did. You take some twine which you found and begin to join the sticks together.

"Whew. There all done." You murmured to yourself as you make the finishing touches. It isn't watertight, but at least it's something. You decide then to go get some firewood, which took something like 30 minutes. When you come back, you see...
111122.title: Don't take chances.

choices: You can survive without food for a while, get shelter going first.
You'll work better when fed, get food first.
1111221.content:
Coming back with a decent ammount of fire wood, you had a few bundles of twigs, larger sticks, and finally two large broken branches. Heafting them down you huffed, releaving the weight from your arms.

Finally, you look back up, and see your little makeshift hut decimated. In a bit of shock, you look through the broken sticks and snapped twine. Now you knew something was wrong. Someone was messing with you for sure now.

So you decide now. You have to rebuild your hut. This time you should probably stick around. But food will become a problem too... You dont know weither you should go get food first, or make camp and then look. Which to do first though?
1111221.title: ...your camp is destroyed!

choices: Stay here and sleep, get your fire going, you don't want to risk anything.
Go out and look for food, but stay close. It's almost night.
11112211.content:
Scratching at your head you lick your lips and make up your mind. You could survive without food for a while longer, right now you needed shelter, and water. If you could find a coconut or something, you could boil down seawater and drink that, but for now, you had shelter on your mind.

Scrapping most of the twine and branches into your fire wood, you kept what could still be used, and went out once more to get larger branches and vines to create a new hut.

Sticking close to your wood pile, and keeping an eye on it, you find a good ammount more sticks, and a decent enough ammount of vines. Taking the supplies back, you also happen upon a large sheet of driftwood, which you take as well.

After another good hour of work afterwards, you have a nice hut going, putting alot more time into it. You broke up the drift wood, making a sheet of wood surrounding the top, so that rain would run off and onto the ground around you. Using large palm leaves, you had a floor that would keep you dry and warm as well, while also having a decent roof over your head, even if it wasn't very roomy.

You look out, and see the sun begin to fade out. Your stomach growls hungerly, and you whine a bit, feeling reality hit you. You were stranded, helpless and alone, with no food, water, or comfort. You were really hungry... And with little light left, you might have a small chance to look for a bit.
11112211.title: Shelter it is.

choices: You hear a noise late into the night. The fire is growing dim.
You wake up early in the morning, and the fire is almost out, save for embers.
111122111.content:
You shake your head, trying to push away thoughts of hunger, and instead busy yourself with the fire. You should have started sooner, but this would work for now. Taking the smaller pile of twigs and dead grasses, you begin to smack two rocks together overtop of it in a small hole you dug out just outside of your shelter. This way it wouldn't catch your hut on fire, but wouldnt be completely put out if it started raining.

After what seemed like forever, a spark finally hit, and began to burn at the grass. You cupped it gently and began to blow carefully, making it burn more, before fire suddenly errupted from the grasses, setting the twigs ablaze. You quickly set it into the hole, and worked quickly, putting smaller sticks inside as well to feed the flames.

Before too much longer, the fire was going steadily. You knew, that while it wouldn't stay completly lit all night, if you fed it right, you could keep it going past you falling asleep, and then easily start it up tomorrow with the remaining embers.

Huffing a bit, you pushed back, warm, but still uncomfortable. Thoughts began to rack your head, but you fell back anyways, and sleep hit you like a truck. With such an eventful day, you slept rather well, dreamless and exhausted.
111122111.title: Depressing fire and dreamless sleep.

1112.content: So you go to the forest. It looks like a good idea to find some food there. There you find some apples. You pluck the apples until you see a very small Pokemon, not very harmful but safe. What is it?
1112.title: To the forest we go!

11121.content: You see a Wurmple crawling toward you, it looks up at the leaves of the apple tree and you realize that it's hungry. So you pulled off a branch an put it right next to the Wurmple. The Wurmple became happy as it eats the leaves of the branch. Suddenly the Wurmple rises up as it hears something. After that it runs off. You hide from behind the bush to see...
11121.title: Hungry Wurmple

choices: You try to find some sticks to make a shelter.
You hear something big coming your way.
111212.content: You see a regular sized Starly, flying around probably serching for food. It lands on what appears to be your head. It cries out by its name realizing that it was standing on you. It then lands on the ground and looks up at you, as it is saying its name again. You feel like it wants to be your friend, so you accept.
111212.title: A Friendly Starly

choices: trust Starly's warning and look elsewhere
1112121.content: With the Starly following, you search for any large foliage for a shelter. As you enter a clearing you se a tree in the center with two large leaves sticking from the thin trunk. If you could knock that over, you'de have most of your shelter. But the starly lands on your head and says its name several times in a concerned voice. You think it over, and decide to...
1112121.title: You try to find some sticks to make a shelter.

choices: Run off, its to much of a risk
11121211.content: You ignore starly and push on the tree. But after several minutes you sit against the tree defeated. Then the ground begins to shake and the clearing seems to explode as dirt and grass fly everywhere. You fly up in the air, as a giant Turtwig breaks out of the ground. It sees you and opens its mouth to catch you. You slide down its snout as it snaps its jaws shut. You wrap your arms around the tree on its head as it shakes and thrashes. You see a chajce to slide off of the pokemon, and jump off when its distracted by Starly buzzinvg around its face. You could run, but Starly would no doubt be eaten. But if you reveal yourself you risk getting eaten yourself.
11121211.title: Uproot the tree

1112122.content: Much to your suprise, the ground starts to rhythmically shake. *Boom* *Boom* *Boom* The rumbling gets louder and louder as something seems to approach. You foolishly decide to stick around to see what's heading in your direction, which you will later regret. You notice trees in the distance being knocked down. "Dang! Must be something pretty big if it's able to knock down trees!" You think to yourself. Then you look up and see something very scary. A gigantic Gardevoir! You gotta really think fast if you wanna live here! Run, or stick around to see if it's friendly? It's really your decision... But think fast!
1112122.title: A Wild Gardevoir Appears!

11121221.content: You start to run away from the 'giant maiden' while Starly follows you. That is when Starly flies to a different direction. "Where are you going?" you say to Starly. It starts chirping as if it wants you to follow it. "This better work" you will say as you follow your bird-like friend. Where does it take you?
11121221.title: RUN FOR YOUR FREAKING LIVES!!!!!!

choices: Something huge comes out of the woods behind you
Something huge rises out of the ocean before you
111212211.content: The Starly flies along, and you chase after it until you leave the forest and make it to a beach. The Starly lands on the sand in front of you, jumping around as it glances about. You wonder why the bird led you here; the beach is empty, and doesn't provide any cover from the giant Gardevoir. You wonder if the Starly was expecting to find something here--or maybe someone--but before you can think about it any more...
111212211.title: Back to the beach

1112122112.content:
In an eruption of sea water.
Splashing the starly causing it to fly off into the woods.
Before you is a...
1112122112.title: Something huge rises out of the ocean before you

choices: Friendship. You stay where you are.
11121221121.content: A massive 85ft 4in Gyrados springs from the water, towering over the human. Its scales were of a strange color palette; Dark blue with black accents and purple fins/whiskers. It looked down at the small human and opened her mouth in a lopsided smile, showing her sharp fangs. The human seemed to take this as a sign of
11121221121.title: Gyarados

choices: The starly flies out of the hole, swooping to pick you up
The starly falls out of the hole, shocked by an angry Pachirisu hiding inside!
111212212.content: The starly keeps flying, and you can barely keep up with it even though it's moving just slow enough for your tiny form to keep up. You see it fly into a hole in a tree, amd you realize that might be its home. You look for a way to get inside, finding no easy way because the tree is big and you are tiny. You're about to shout for the Starly's help when suddenly...
111212212.title: A hole in a tree.

choices: Reach out with her free hand and stroke the back of your head to calm you down.
Lift you over her gaping mouth and drop you in for a quick snack!
11121222.content:
As the gigantic Gardevoir approached your location, you were in absolute awe of its sheer size and beauty. You were able to tell that it was clearly female, judging by the finesse that it displayed with each of its motions and the sweet feminine smile it wore on its massive face. Something inside you was still telling you to run as far away from her as possible before she noticed you, but at the same time the dazzling sight of her had left you unable to move.

Within mere moments the colossal pokemon had landed her foot mere inches away from where you were standing. The massive green sole collided with the ground and you were knocked off of your feet by the force of the impact. As you laid on your back and stared up at the towering figure of this titanic Gardevoir, you were completely frozen in a mixture of fear and awe. Just then, the enormous Gardevoir knelt down and leaned her head in to get a closer view of you. A playful grin spread across her face.

Before you even knew what was happening, you found your body enveloped in a light blue aura, and the grand Gardevoir lifted you into the air with her psychic powers. You knew instantly that it was now too late to turn back. Now that she had you in her telekinetic grip, you had absolutely no hope of escaping from her. You can do nothing but wait nervously as the Gardevoir stands back up to her full height and drops your into the palm of her enormous hand.

Holding your tiny life in the palm of her hand (literally), she then proceeds to...
11121222.title: Taking your chances...

choices: "You don't need to worry. They're hiding in a cave and are completely unharmed."
"Their life forces were quite faint. I'm afraid that they are in grave danger!"
111212221.content:
As you sit in the palm of her hand, simply waiting in nervous anticipation of what she would do to you next, you couldn't help but begin to tremble in fear. Noticing this, the Gardevoir reached toward you with her free hand. She began to stroke the back of your head with her index finger, which was easily just as big as your entire body, being incredibly careful not to hurt you as she did so. You could suddenly feel all of your fears beginning to melt away under the gentle touch of this giant Gardevoir. Soon you had finally calmed down, and feeling your trembling stop, Gardevoir ceased her stroking and looked down at you with a tender smile displayed on her face. No sooner had she stopped stroking you than you heard a beautiful feminine voice echoing in your mind.

"That's right, little human... You have no reason to fear me. I promise that I won't harm you in any way."

You look around a bit for the source of the voice, and seeing that you and Gardevoir were the only ones left in the area, you looked up at her confused.

"Was... Was that you?"

She simply nodded to confirm your suspicions.

"B-but how?" you asked her.

Gardevoir just giggled before responding.

"Silly human, don't you know that I'm a psychic type pokemon? It's not too uncommon for a psychic type to have the ability to use telepathy to communicate with humans, is it?"

"Hehe, I guess not..."

"So human, might I ask what brings you here to this island?"

"*sigh* It's a long story..."

"Oh really? Would you please tell me?"

"Alright..."

You then begin to recount the events that lead up to you becoming stranded on the island. After telling her everything that happened, Gardevoir had a sympathetic expression on her face.

"Oh, you poor little thing. That must have been so hard for you. You know, this island is inhabited by many other pokemon who are just as big as me, and not many of them are as kind as I am. You're very lucky that I found you before any of them did. Out of the hundreds of us living on this island, only a handful of us think of humans as anything more than a quick snack. This is a very dangerous place for your kind."

You immediately panic as you hear this.

"Oh no! My parents!"

"What's that?"

"I got separated from my family when we first arrived here! If what you just said is true, then my mom and dad are probably in huge trouble right now!"

"What?! Oh dear... That truly is a problem... I can hardly imagine what they might be going through right now..."

"Please Gardevoir, you have to help me! Help me save my parents, please!"

"But of course! I would be glad to do anything I can to assist you, human. Please wait just a moment..."

With that, Gardevoir placed you atop her shoulder and closed her eyes as she began to focus her psychic powers. Using her powers, she scanned the entire island for the life force of any other humans. After a few seconds, Gardevoir's eyes opened again and she spoke into your mind with her telepathy once again.

"I've found them! I just located the life forces of two other humans, and they aren't too far from here."

You breath out a sigh of relief as you hear this.

"That's great! Can you tell if they're okay or not?"

"Yes, well, about that..."
111212221.title: Gardevoir is a gentle giant

1112122211.content:
"Yes, well, about that, I just found out that they happen to be in my home, which is one of the many cave systems on this Island."

"Oh Thank the Lord, or in this case, the Gardevoir." You said, making a really bad joke.

"Heh, You humans are such a funny kind."

"Well, we do have many problems with our kind as well." You say. "I wish you could come with us, and protect us you know?"

"I'll do it! It's always been a dream of mine to shelter with humans."

"So, recap of today, stranded on an island filled with the same kind of Pokemon we have back home, but only much more larger in size, found out Parents are alive and well, and have recruited a Sexy Giantess Protector Pokemon. I'm sure that'll get me at least 7 weeks allowance." You say, making Gardevoir giggle again.

Soon Gardevoir and You made it to her home, and found her parents in a parachute, using it like a tent.

"Humans, You can come out now."

2 People came out of the Parachute Tent, and freaked out when they saw you with the Giantess Gardevoir. "Alright, I'm gonna go see my parents, and a quick way down, may be some semi-inappropriate parkour." You say to Gardevoir.

You're free to do this Parkour you speak of."

1123323121211211221.content:
You rush the Goodra just before it has the chance to seize the rodents. Your Stone Edge and Crunch making quick work of the Dragon. As the expecting Goodra collapses from your attack, you notice the electric rodents fleeing. All but the Plusle. The gen 3 positive rodent is nowhere to be seen but you didn't see it run away with the others. You shrug and decide to eat the Goodra.

As you are bending over to begin consuming the Dragon type, you notice sparks lighting up the Goodra's belly. Must be the Plusle. You think as you press against the Goodra's stomach. In response you feel something pawing at the area just beneath your massive claw. Still alive? You muse as you apply a little more pressure. The pawing increases, clearly the added pressure is crushing the creature inside Goodra's stomach.

With a chuckle you lift your claw and pick up the defeated Goodra. At your size, you could easily swallow the Goodra whole. You pondered what to do. Sure you were hunger but part of you wanted to see the fearful gaze of Goodra's plus one.
1123323121211211221.title: Goodra

11233231212112112212.content:
A smirk forms on your face as you squeeze the Goodra until the smaller Pokemon is forced up the throat. After a moment, you open the Goodra's mouth and the Plusle you saw earlier tumbles into your awaiting claw. You tighten your grip on Plusle as you re-position slightly. The Plusle looks up at you with a look of horror plastered to its face.

Your stomach growls impatiently causing you to smirk. The way you are gripping Plusle, the electric rodent is forced to watch as you take the Goodra into your awaiting mouth. It only takes a couple of swallows before the Dragon type disappears down your throat. "Mhmm~" You purr as you press the Plusle against your throat and drag it down your chest, following the Goodra's descent into your body. "Feels good doesn't it." You rumble as you feel the Dragon type fall into your stomach. You keep the electric type pressed against your belly, feeling it struggle in fear. Before long the Goodra comes to and begins struggling like mad.

Plusle whimpers as the Goodra's struggles become more frantic. "Oh please, that sorry sack of Dragon was going to do the same to you. In fact, you owe me your life." Your voice booms above the Plusle. It whimpers again, looking up towards your face. You smirk down at the helpless Electric type. "After eating the gooey thing, my jaw feels a bit gummed up. How about you fix that for me?" You weren't going to give the Electric type a choice. It was going into your mouth regardless.

You bring the Plusle up to your mouth and drop it onto you tongue. To your surprise though, the Electric Pokemon doesn't try to leap out. Instead it begins pawing around your mouth, and between your teeth, clearing all goo left behind by the Goodra. You chuckle slightly, the sound echoing around the Plusle. Sitting back, you enjoy the feeling of the tiny form moving around in your mouth. You even leave your mouth open to allow your host enough light to remove all the goo. Your eyes begin drifting closed as you enjoy the sensation brought upon you by the Plusle's movements.

"Excuse me... Sir?" The Plusle begins, her voice shaking.

"What?" You growl, your voice booming all around her.

"I got all the goo out from between your teeth." She whimpers.

You ponder for a moment. You could easily swallow the Plusle. Or you could keep her around as your pet.
11233231212112112212.title: Fear

Not that your were surprised. After all you ate a Goodra in front of her then forced her into your mouth. "Good work, Tiny One. I may just prolong your life." You chuckle as you hold the Plusle on your open palm. "Now then, what to do with you..." You rub your chin with your other claw as you think.

Plusle looks down at your belly and seems to have an idea. "Sir..." She begins weakly. You look at her, about to growl because of her speaking. "I can rub your belly." She whimpers as your gazed harshly at her.

A dark grin forms on your face causing Plusle to shudder. "A belly rub is it?" You begin as you move Plusle to---
112332312121121122122.title: Tyranitar's pet

1123323121211211221221.content:
You lay back and place Plusle on the blue part of your belly. "Get to it." You growl.

Plusle nods and starts rubbing your impressive belly. As small as she is, you were barely feeling anything. This normal sized Plusle (1'04") tried and tried, but an impatient growl from you indicated that you were not amused. "Is that all you've got? I can't even feel it." You snarl as your claw comes up behind the Plusle. You press her hard against your belly and begin moving your claw up and down your belly. The motion drags the Plusle along and you can hear her whimper, you can feel her shaking under your claw. "That's more like it." You growl as you keep dragging Plusule roughly against the blue skin of you belly.

"Mister... please... stop..." Plusle whimpers, tears begin to run free as her skin begins to feel raw from your roughness.

You pick her up between two of your nails, dangling her in front of your face. "Stop? You dare order me?" You roared at her. The look of complete fear plasted to the Plusle's face made you smirk. "I know how to make you rub and me feel it." You say in a dark menacing tone.

Before the Plusle can respond, you tosses her into your mouth again. Your first thought is to swallow the Plusle so that you can feel her pawing at your stomach in her final moments. But you soon feel her rubbing your gums and tongue. The feeling is amazing and sends a shiver down your spine. You had never felt anything this good. Then the thought of keeping her in your mouth and letting her rub your gums and tongue crossed your mind.
1123323121211211221221.title: Your belly, normal belly rub

choices: Trust her, let Plusle sleep outside your mouth
Make Plusle sleep in your mouth
11233231212112112212212.content:
"Pulsle." Your voice booms.

"Y-y-y-yes?" comes the frightened response.

"I'll make you a deal." You state, being careful not to send your host too close to your throat. "I'll let you live and even take care of you, in exchange, you stay with me and rub the inside of my mouth." You add as you stand and prepare to walk back to your cave.

Plusle doesn't waste any time. "Yes sir." She says and she presses harder against your gums, massaging them. You moan in bliss as the electric rodent continues rubbing the inside of your mouth.

You flick your tongue, forcing the Plusle under your tongue before you speak. "I'm going to be closing my jaws until we're back home. Wouldn't want you falling out." You say before closing your jaws, sealing the electric type in complete darkness. As you trek back to your cave, you can feel the Plusle making herself comfortable inside. A faint smile crosses your face as you enjoy the movements.

Upon returning to your cave, you sit back to relax and open your jaws allowing Plusle to have some light. She continues to do her best to keep you pleased. After several hours, night falls and you determine its time for bed. The one thing you didn't think about was where you were going to keep Plusle during the night.
11233231212112112212212.title: Mouth rubs

112332312121121122122122.content:
You lay back on your leaf bed, with the Plusle still in your mouth. A deep tired yawn escapes you and you get comfortable. The Plusle perks up slightly upon hearing your yawn. "Mister Tyranitar...?" She says slowly as she rubs the front of your mouth just behind your teeth.

You yawn again, flicking your tongue to pin Plusle to the side of you mouth. "I'm going to bed, Tiny One. You're going to stay in my jaws until morning. Don't worry though; I won't swallow you. Just try not to move around too much during the night." Your voice shakes her as it booms around the Plusle. Carefully you begin to close your jaws, as you do you move the Plusle behind your teeth to avoid harming her. Soon your eyes drift closed but you haven't fallen asleep yet.

Plusle nods slightly, understanding the situation. You can feel her on your tongue, making herself comfy. A weak tired yawn escapes her and she soon curls up on your tongue. Before long the young electric type falls asleep on your tongue. You smile slightly as you finally begin to doze off.

During the night your wake up. You look around, as though checking the area. You were sure you heard something but there didn't seem to be anything nearby. You feel Plusle still sleeping soundly on your tongue. You slow stand and scope out the area.

11233232122211.content:
You yawn as you sit up. It had been stormy last night so you didn’t get out to hunt and instead had stayed sheltered in your cave. You overlook the scenery before departing from your cave to hunt. You soon spot a 10ft Monferno tormenting something. The opposing Fire Type looks like it’d make a great meal. Quickly you rush forward seizing Monferno in you claws before shoveling it into your mouth. As you swallow you look at the groun to see what the Monferno was tormenting.

Lying on the ground were two humans. They looked as though they were in their mid to late teens. You leaned forward to get a closer look. Both trembling under your fierce blue eyes. The older of the two was a boy with cobalt hair and the slightly younger looking one was a girl with blonde hair.

You reached out with your claws, scooping both of them up and looking them over.
11233232122211.title: 25 ft

choices: Spend the day getting to know each other
Fast forward to you needing to hunt
112332321222112.content:
“Hello...” you say slowly. For your size you were actually very shy. “It’s ok, I’m not going to h-h-hurt you. E-e-either if y-y-you.” You mentally curse at your stuttering problem.

The boy steps forward, clearing wanting to ensure he was between your gaze and the other human. “How does a Charmeleon get so big?” He asks as he smiles at you.

You smile back before indicating one of the large signs posted nearby. The two humans look over and read it over. Caution experiments on going. “There’s n-n-no human ex-ex-experiments on Pokémon anymore. Not since the First destroyed their facility and ate all the humans. But the con-con-containments are still in the soil and air.” You say as you watch the humans on your palm.

“Hey Char! Where are you?!”

“Who was—-“

You don’t give the humans a chance to finish the question as you put them in your mouth, under your tongue. “Don’t make a sound.” You whisper to them, hoping they wouldn’t be too angry with your

“There you are. Me and Wartortle been looking for you. Wanted to make sure that storm didn’t hurt you too much.” Your friend Ivysaur says as she runs up to you.

“Aww, don’t worry, I’m fine.” You reply, your cheeks blushing.

“There he is!” Wartortle calls as he catches up. “Told you he’d be fine, Seedie.”

“I still worry about him, Shelidon.” Seedie replies.

You feel the two humans shift under your tongue, clearly an uncomfortable shift. “Hey, while I’m fine and all, I’m a bit tired. Those storm clouds had me nervous so I didn’t sleep much. I’m going to retire to my cave. We’ll hang tomorrow.” You says as you walk back to your cave thankful neither of your friends questioned you.

Once in the privacy of your cave you gently spit both humans onto your claw. “Sorry about that. Seedie and Shelidon both hate humans after their trainers gave them up for the experimentations.”

“What about you? You don’t?” The boy asks.

“I never had a trainer. The scientists found me and experimented on me. But I never had a trainer like the others did. We were given codenames, guess those sort of stuck for what we call one another.”

“So what’s your name?” The girl asks.

You look down. “Stray. But Seedie and Shelidon call me Char.”

“You look like an Ebony to me.” The girl says as she looks up at you.

You smile as you return your gaze to the humans. “What about the two of you?”

“I’m Rizu. And this is my big brother, Kuromu.” The girl says.

You say the names to yourself making sure you’ll remember them. “It’s a pleasure to meet you both.”

You realise that the Oshawott thinks you're a Jynx and you say 'I'm a human not a Jynx' and he's like 'WHAT! you're a human!!' and then he apoligises for the assault. You ask the little otter how to get out of the island, so he wants you to follow him. You then spot some orange slime so you touch it and it hurts so much and Oshawott uses water gun to take the slime out of your hand, but then a huge Braviary comes out of nowhere and takes you away while Oshawott falls into the slime, but then there was a huge stream of water which hits Braviary which releases you and you fall to your death and 'OH MY GOD! I'm gonna die!' and Oshawott who somehow grew about the size of you was like "no you're not.' and he saves you. Later on you meet this huge Samurott and tells you the only person, or pokemon to be exact, with the ability to grow dark can lead you to safety. So you and Oshawott go out to find the pokemon but you both take a rest for the next day. And the next day Oshawott gets ambushed by a Huge Arbok but bloats it up with water so much that the Arbok gets flown away. And then, Oshawott evolves into a Dewott. Later you go out to collect some berries and you get attacked by Zekrom, who is the pokemon you were suppose to look for. Then you're saved by Dewott again and you found out that Zekrom has a thorn in its foot and you get it out and Zekrom comes to his senses and thanks you and Dewott and takes you to a temple of the Sacred weapon of some sort. And you and Dewott avoid a lot of traps and junk and then you get to the weapon's room but by the time you grab it, the room started to turn 'evil'...and you get ambushed by Ariados and Spinaraks but you took down most of them with your weapon and you got out of the temple in time. Later you start training with Samurott and then you and Dewott go to the mountain summit to fight the Macro but then you get ambushed by the same Arbok from last time and starts eating Dewott, and if you don't save him you will become Arbok's slave forever, but if you save Dewott by slashing Arbok's face with your weapon, you will save Dewott and he will blast Arbok off into the sky. After that, you both made it to the summit and Dewott says good-bye. You then fight against Ho-Oh, the macro of the female character's story. And you start blocking its attacks and slash it with your weapon and then after it falls to the ground all KO'd the thud was so fierce that you fall off a cliff and then you die.
But then you meet this armored guy who tells you that you completed your quest and you suddenly wake up in a hospital, and you find out that your instructor was there and was actually alive and said that you were in a coma. So you get ready for your mission with the Earth Defenders and that's how the story ends and yeah. The male character's story is similar but there are different pokemon in that story. I hope this will help you get to the true ending and yeah have a good time! ;)
124.title: Warning! Buttload of Spoilers!

info.brief_description: You get lost on an island of man-eating pokemon! Will you survive or get eaten?
info.description:
You are stranded on an island full of giant pokemon that want to eat you. You decide if you will survive or get eaten. There are rules for this story:

There should be no licking or chewing as it is very gross.
Some Pokemon can talk also but make sure there are no pokemorphs or pokeanthros.
You can choose to be either a male or a female, both genders have different paths.
Also, if you are a pokemon, there are no humans in the pokemon version of the story. Also, I absolutely don't want any Anthros or anything that is 'Adult' specific. I forgot to put them down and I had to delete a lot of chapters. >.<

Enjoy making the story.
